page.title: 02History of Gnosall
page.content: The name "Gnosall" in Norman times was "Geneshale" which when translated means "village in the valley" Domesday entry In 1086, the Domesday entry for Geneshale was 2 hides (100 hectares) and 3 virgates (37.5 hectares). There is enough land for two ploughs. On the lord's land there are 4 ploughs. There are 8 villagers who own land and 4 who do not. There is a mill worth 12d. The village is worth 15 shillings. 1680 In 1680 there were not many houses near the church but there were a few houses at Audmore which is NE of the church. 1980's Now there are large housing estates round the church which have joined up with Audmore.
